result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
Shall not have contact with victim, A.M.E. (DOB 06-02-93) unless approved by Agent.
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not enter into or loiter near any establishment where the main purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, including liquor stores.

Domestic Violence Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.
Any Assessments and Counseling as recommended by DOC.
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided.
ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN THIS CASE WILL BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CALUMET COUNTY CLERK OF COURT OFFICE AND NOT YOUR PROBATION AGENT.  If you are not able to pay in full within 60 days, please call 920-849-1414 and speak to the Account Clerk to establish a payment plan.  Probation Agent is responsible to monitor ongoing payments to make sure all obligations are paid as a part of probation conditions.
If financial obligations are not paid in full and you have not contacted the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days, a civil judgment shall be entered against you for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect this debt, including sending unpaid obligations to the State Debt Collection Agency.

timeConds.notes: With Huber - STAYED - Court reserves the right to impose upon recommendation of agent. Transfer permitted.

947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct

Shall not have contact with victim, A.M.E.  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
